properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 1 at 3:56PM PST until February 3 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, areas of northwest to north
winds 25 to 35 mph with damaging gusts up to 60 mph. For the
Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures in the mid 20s to lower
30s will be possible in wind sheltered areas.

* WHERE...Ventura County Interior Valleys.

* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 8 PM Sunday to noon PST
Monday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Sunday night through
Monday morning.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down large objects such as
trees and power lines. Power outages are likely. Travel will be
difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and
freeze conditions could kill crops and other sensitive
vegetation.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds expected Sunday night near
the Highway 33 corridor, including Lake Casitas and Ojai. The
coldest temperatures late Sunday night into early Monday
morning are expected in the wind sheltered portions of the Ojai
Valley.
properties.instruction:
People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around
trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of
your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if
you must drive.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for
extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM SUNDAY TO NOON PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING
